tvestergaard.fog.presentation

Class CsrfProtector

  • java.lang.Object
    • tvestergaard.fog.presentation.CsrfProtector

  • public class CsrfProtector
extends java.lang.Object
    Generates and verifies Base64 tokens used to protect against Cross Site Request Forgery. Uses the SecureRandom number generator when generating the tokens.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description

      Creates a new CsrfProtector.

      Creates a new CsrfProtector.

      Creates a new CsrfProtector.

    • Constructor Detail

      • CsrfProtector

        public CsrfProtector(int entropy,
                     int maximum)
        Creates a new CsrfProtector.
        Parameters:
        entropy - The entropy of the tokens generated by the CsrfProtector in bytes.
        maximum - The maximum number of tokens that can be registered with the CsrfProtector.

      • CsrfProtector

        public CsrfProtector(int entropy)
        Creates a new CsrfProtector. The maximum number of tokens that can be registered with the CsrfProtector is set to 10.
        Parameters:
        entropy - The entropy of the tokens generated by the CsrfProtector in bytes.

      • CsrfProtector

        public CsrfProtector()
        Creates a new CsrfProtector. The entropy of the tokens generated by the CsrfProtector in bytes is set to 32. The maximum number of tokens that can be registered with the CsrfProtector is set to 10.

    • Method Detail

      • generate

        public java.lang.String generate(int entropy)
        Generates and registers a token with the provided entropy.

        If the insertion of the newly generated token exceeds the maximum number if tokens allowed, the oldest registered token is removed.

        Parameters:
        entropy - The entropy of the token to generate in bytes.
        Returns:
        The newly generated token.

      • generate

        public java.lang.String generate()
        Generates and registers a token with the configured entropy in bytes.

        If the insertion of the newly generated token exceeds the maximum number if tokens allowed, the oldest registered token is removed.

        Returns:
        The newly generated token.

      • verify

        public boolean verify(java.lang.String token,
                      boolean remove)
        Verifies that the provided token is registered with the CsrfProtector.
        Parameters:
        token - The token to verify.
        remove - Whether or not the remove the token afterwards.
        Returns:
        true when the token could be verified.

      • verify

        public boolean verify(java.lang.String token)
        Verifies that the provided token is registered with the CsrfProtector. Removes the token afterwards.
        Parameters:
        token - The token to verify.
        Returns:
        true when the token could be verified.

      • size

        public int size()
        Returns the number of tokens in the CsrfProtector.
        Returns:
        The number of tokens in the CsrfProtector.

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Removes the tokens registered with the CsrfProtector.

        public boolean isEmpty()
        Checks if there are no tokens registered with the CsrfProtector.
        Returns:
        true if there are no tokens registered with the CsrfProtector.

        public int getEntropy()
